export-screen.content.section-1.headline: Your overview
export-screen.content.section-1.text: Collectively we can reconstruct paths of infection by informing health authorities and the people around you.
export-screen.content.section-2.headline: With great power comes great responsibility
export-screen.content.section-2.text: Keep in mind that the data is very sensitive. We highly recommend to not share it online or with random people.
export-screen.modals.request-user-data.t: To ensure that the export is complete and can be assigned, please enter your first and last name. If you have already been in contact with the Health Department and have received a case ID, please also enter this.
export-screen.modals.export-completed.te: The export of your overview was successfully created. You can now share or save it.
If your public health department works with the SORMAS software, you should choose the CSV file.
legal-screen.header.headline: Legal
legal-screen.tabs.privacy.label: Privacy
legal-screen.tabs.imprint.label: Imprint
legal-screen.tabs.licenses.label: Licenses
legal-screen.privacy.section-1.headline: Data processing of the app
legal-screen.privacy.section-1.text: App Coronika processes personal and location-related data exclusively locally on the smartphone of the user.
legal-screen.privacy.section-2.headline: Personal data
legal-screen.privacy.section-2.text: The user can create persons within the app. The name and a telephone number are saved. Furthermore, it is possible to import the phone book of the smartphone. The names and phone numbers of the entries in the phonebook are transferred to the app. All the data remains locally on the smartphone and therefore in the hands of the user. The data is never transferred to the app provider or third parties.
legal-screen.privacy.section-3.headline: Location-based data
legal-screen.privacy.section-3.text: The user can create locations within the app. The name of the location and a description are saved. The user's location via positioning services (e.g. GPS or similar) is not accessed at any time. The location-related data also remains local on the user's smartphone and is not transmitted to the app provider or third parties.
legal-screen.privacy.section-4.headline: Diary
legal-screen.privacy.section-4.text: Within the diary, the user assigns persons and places to individual days on a daily basis. In addition to the data already collected, a time is also stored for the places. The diary and all entries also remain locally on the user's smartphone and are not transmitted to the app provider or third parties.
legal-screen.privacy.section-5.headline: Export
legal-screen.privacy.section-5.text: Within the app the user has an export function to export a section of the diary as a PDF file. The PDF file is created locally on the user's smartphone. This PDF file can be used to easily provide health authorities or other official bodies with a list of contacts in a selected period of time in order to trace paths of infection and, if necessary, inform other people about a potential infection. The user is responsible for handling the PDF file and the data contained in it responsibly and not to pass it on carelessly.
legal-screen.privacy.section-6.headline: Data transfer and tracking
legal-screen.privacy.section-6.text: The app does not provide automated tracking or data transfer to the app provider or third parties. The only exception is the export function. There, however, only the user decides to whom the data is passed on. Otherwise, all data remains locally on the user's smartphone.

legal-screen.imprint.section-2.headline: Liability for contents
legal-screen.imprint.section-2.text: As a service provider, we are responsible for our own content on these pages according to Â§ 7 para.1 TMG (German Telemedia Act) and general laws. According to Â§Â§ 8 to 10 TMG, we are not obliged to monitor transmitted or stored external information or to investigate circumstances that indicate illegal activity. Obligations to remove or block the use of information according to general laws remain unaffected. However, liability in this respect is only possible from the time of knowledge of a concrete infringement. If we become aware of any such infringements, we will remove such content immediately.
legal-screen.imprint.section-3.headline: Liability for links
legal-screen.imprint.section-3.text: Our offer contains links to external websites of third parties, on whose contents we have no influence. Therefore we cannot assume any liability for these external contents. The respective provider or operator of the sites is always responsible for the contents of the linked sites. The linked pages were checked for possible legal violations at the time of linking. Illegal contents were not recognizable at the time of linking. However, a permanent control of the contents of the linked pages is not reasonable without concrete evidence of a violation of the law. If we become aware of any infringements, we will remove such links immediately.
legal-screen.imprint.section-4.headline: Copyright
legal-screen.imprint.section-4.text: The contents and works on these pages created by the operators are subject to German copyright law. The reproduction, editing, distribution and any kind of use outside the limits of copyright law require the written consent of the respective author or creator. Downloads and copies of these pages are only permitted for private, non-commercial use. Insofar as the content on this site was not created by the operator, the copyrights of third parties are respected. In particular, third-party content is marked as such. Should you nevertheless become aware of a copyright infringement, please inform us accordingly. If we become aware of any infringements, we will remove such contents immediately.

splash-screen.supported-by.headline: With friendly support of
tips-screen.header.headline: Hygiene tips
tips.am-i-infected.headline: I'm afraid I got the coronavirus, what can I do?
tips.am-i-infected.text: If you are worried that you might have been infected, stay at home so that you do not infect other people. Contact your family doctor or health authorities by phone. If you are indeed infected with coronavirus, tell your doctor and the health authorities about your Coronika diary in order to contain the spread of the disease. In this case you can simply export your diary and send it to the responsible authorities.
tips.avoid-crowds-of-people.list.item-2: choose walking instead of public transport to cover short distancess
tips.avoid-crowds-of-people.list.item-3: wash your hands regularly and thoroughly
tips.avoid-crowds-of-people.list.item-4: maintain a distance of approximately 2 meters between you and other people
tips.avoid-crowds-of-people.list.item-5: cover your coughs and sneezes with your elbow or a tissue
tips.avoid-crowds-of-people.headline: Avoid crowds of people
tips.avoid-crowds-of-people.text: If possible, avoid going on trips, using public transport and instead work from home. In general, any contacts should be reduced to the essential ones and the attendance of events with crowds of people should be avoided.
tips.corona-warn-app.headline: Help contain the virus further with the Corona-Warn-App
tips.corona-warn-app.text-1: The Corona-Warn-App helps to determine whether we have come into contact with an infected person and whether there is a risk of infection. This way we can break chains of infection more quickly. The app is an offer from the federal government of Germany. Download and use of the app is completely voluntary. It is available for free in the App Store and on Google Play.
tips.corona-warn-app.text-2: We from Coronika recommend the Corona-Warn-App: Help us and the Corona-Warn-App to record contacts manually and automatically to overcome this crisis as fast as possible.
tips.coughing-sneezing.list.item-1: maintain a distance of approximately 2 meters between you and other people
tips.coughing-sneezing.list.item-3: cover your coughs and sneezes with your elbow or a tissue
tips.coughing-sneezing.headline: Proper coughing and sneezing
tips.coughing-sneezing.text: To prevent the spread of viruses,  please pay attention to:
tips.distance-and-mouthguard.headline: Keep your distance and wear a mouthguard
tips.distance-and-mouthguard.text-1: Distance and mouthguards in shops or public transport help to contain the spread of the virus. Always keep a safety distance of 1.5m and always wear a mouth and nose protector correctly.
tips.distance-and-mouthguard.text-2: Further information on the current hygiene rules and recommendations can be found here:
tips.mouthguard.list.item-1: the mask is made from paper
tips.mouthguard.list.item-2: the mask does not fit tight to the face or is leaking
tips.mouthguard.list.item-4: it is not replaced several times each day
tips.mouthguard.headline: Mouthguard, yes or no?
tips.mouthguard.list.intro: Wearing a mask outside of surgery has no effect if:
tips.mouthguard.text-1: Masks are essential for all health sectors. For sick people or people with symptoms of COVID-19 masks are an appropriate part of infection prevention of others. We recommend you to only wear a mask if your health care provider asks you to. Make sure to follow the hygiene rules.
tips.mouthguard.text-2: Health care providers wear masks as a barrier and it helps to stop tiny droplets from spreading when coughing or sneezing.
tips.not-feeling-well.headline: I don't feel well, do I have the virus?
tips.not-feeling-well.list.intro: Typical symptoms of COVID-19 according to the WHO are:
tips.not-feeling-well.text: Not every patient with flu-like symptoms is also a carrier of the SARS-CoV-2 virus. You should always inform yourself about your symptoms and call your doctor.
tips.reliable-sources.headline: Where can I find reliable sources?
tips-screen.intro.text: Here you will find knowledge that is helping you to reduce the risk of infection as much as possible and to enable you to do the right thing in case of an infection.
tips.washing-hands.list.item-1: Wet your hands with clean, running water (warm or cold), turn off the tap, and apply soap.
tips.washing-hands.list.item-2: Lather your hands by rubbing them together with the soap. Lather the backs of your hands, between your fingers, and under your nails.
tips.washing-hands.list.item-3: Scrub the backs of your hands, thumbs, between your fingers, and under your nails for approximately 30â€“60 seconds.
tips.washing-hands.list.item-4: Rinse your hands well under clean, running water.
tips.washing-hands.list.item-5: Dry your hands using a clean towel or air dry them.
tips.washing-hands.headline: Washing your hands
tips.washing-hands.text: Washing your hands is easy, and itâ€™s one of the most effective ways to prevent the spread of germs. Clean hands can stop germs from spreading. Simply follow these five steps:
welcome-screen.slides.notifications.head: Did you wash your hands?
welcome-screen.slides.notifications.text: Activate your notifications and be reminded regularly to wash your hands to prevent infection.
welcome-screen.slides.import-contacts.te: Coronika can import persons from your phone book so you can start right away.
